availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: This is a manuscript draft of the poem, "Paumanok," which was first published in the New York Herald on February 29, 1888. Reprinted in the "Sands at Seventy" annex to Leaves of Grass (1888).

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Paumanok
bibl.orgName: Walt Whitman Literary Manuscripts in the Walt Whitman Papers, General and Literary Manuscripts, Wilson Library, The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
On the verso of this manuscript is a letter from Robert Pearsall Smith to Walt Whitman, dated 13 February 1888.

lg.l: One side thy inland ocean‸laving, shelter'd
Copiousbeyond with copious commerce steamers sails,
And one the Atlantic's saltwind caresses ing
taking, fierce or gentle wallsand many a mighty hull
Isle of Sweet waters, healthy airs and dark, in the Distance
